dt: {bc}one of the movable feathered or membranous paired appendages by means of which a bird, bat, or insect is able to fly
{bc}such an appendage (as of an ostrich) even though rudimentary or modified so no longer having the power of flight
{bc}any of various anatomical structures (as of a flying fish or flying lemur) providing means of limited flight
{bc}an appendage or part resembling a wing in appearance, position, or function: such as
{bc}a device worn under the arms to aid a person in swimming or staying afloat
{bc}a turned-back or extended edge on an article of clothing
{bc}a sidepiece at the top of an armchair
{bc}a foliaceous, membranous, or woody expansion of a plant especially along a stem or on a samara or capsule
{bc}either of the two lateral petals of a papilionaceous flower {dx}compare {dxt|keel:2|keel:2|2b}{/dx}
{bc}a vane of a windmill or arrow
{bc}an airfoil that develops a major part of the lift which supports a heavier-than-air aircraft
{bc}a means of flight or rapid progress
{bc}a side or outlying region or district
{bc}a part or feature of a building usually projecting from and subordinate to the main or central part
{bc}one of the pieces of scenery at the side of a stage
{bc}the area at the side of the stage out of sight
{bc}a left or right section of an army or fleet {bc}{sx|flank||}
{bc}one of the offensive positions or players on either side of a center position in certain team sports
{bc}either of two opposing groups within an organization or society {bc}{sx|faction||}
{bc}a section of an organized body (such as a legislative chamber) representing a group or faction holding distinct opinions or policies {dx}compare {dxt|left wing||}, {dxt|right wing||}{/dx}
{bc}a unit of the U.S. Air Force higher than a group and lower than a division
{bc}two or more squadrons of naval airplanes
{bc}a dance step marked by a quick outward and inward rolling glide of one foot
{bc}insignia consisting of an outspread pair of stylized bird's {a_link|wings} which are awarded on completion of prescribed training to a qualified pilot, aircrew member, or military balloon pilot
{bc}out of sight in the stage wings
{bc}close at hand in the background {bc}readily available

dt.t: had a plan waiting {it}in the wings{/it}

art.capt: wing 1a: parts of a bird's wing {it}1{/it} coverts, {it}2{/it} primaries, {it}3{/it} secondaries

et: Middle English {it}winge{/it}, of Scandinavian origin; akin to Danish & Swedish {it}vinge{/it} wing; akin to Sanskrit {it}vāti{/it} it blows {ma}{mat|wind:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: one of the movable feathered or membranous paired appendages by means of which a bird, bat, or insect is able to fly; also : such an appendage (as of an ostrich) even though rudimentary or modified so no longer having the power of flight
any of various anatomical structures (as of a flying fish or flying lemur) providing means of limited flight
an appendage or part resembling a wing in appearance, position, or function: such as

dt: {bc}to enable to fly or move swiftly
{bc}to traverse with or as if with wings
{bc}to wound in the wing {bc}disable the wing of
{bc}to wound (as with a bullet) without killing
{bc}to do or perform without preparation or guidelines {bc}{sx|improvise||}
{bc}to go with or as if with wings {bc}{sx|fly||}

shortdef: to enable to fly or move swiftly
to traverse with or as if with wings

dt: {bc}an air-filled device that fits around the arms of a person learning to swim so as to provide buoyancy

shortdef: an air-filled device that fits around the arms of a person learning to swim so as to provide buoyancy

dt: {bc}to limit someone's ability to do or say things

dt.t: They {it}clipped{/it} his {it}wings{/it} by withholding funding for his projects.

shortdef: to limit someone's ability to do or say things

dt: {bc}to officially become a pilot {bc}to receive the license that allows one to fly an airplane, helicopter, etc.

dt.t: He {it}got his wings{/it} as a volunteer by doing work in a soup kitchen.

shortdef: to officially become a pilot : to receive the license that allows one to fly an airplane, helicopter, etc.

dt: {bc}to become more independent and confident {bc}to try doing new things

dt.t: College gave her a chance to {it}spread her wings{/it}.

shortdef: to become more independent and confident : to try doing new things

dt: {bc}a solo tap dance with sharp foot accents, springs, leg flings, and heel clicks

shortdef: a solo tap dance with sharp foot accents, springs, leg flings, and heel clicks

dt: {bc}a deep-fried chicken wing coated with a spicy sauce and usually served with a blue cheese dressing

shortdef: a deep-fried chicken wing coated with a spicy sauce and usually served with a blue cheese dressing

dt: {bc}a triangular swept-back airplane wing with a usually straight trailing edge

shortdef: a triangular swept-back airplane wing with a usually straight trailing edge
